steps.title: Brush a permanent gold tooth like a natural tooth.
steps.content: Brush a permanent gold tooth like a natural tooth. Gold teeth are simple to clean, and can be cleaned just like the rest of your teeth. [1] X Expert Source Alina Lane, DDS Board Certified Dentist Expert Interview. 21 April 2020. Use toothpaste and brush your teeth with a toothbrush. Make sure to brush your teeth twice each day.

steps.title: Floss
steps.content: Floss regularly. Make sure you are flossing around your gold tooth just like the rest of your natural teeth. Though gold teeth help reduce wear on adjacent teeth and slow tooth decay to the underlying tooth, [2] X Research source they still need to be taken care of. Make sure to floss around your tooth while flossing the rest of your teeth. You should floss at least once a day.

steps.title: Know whitening agents won’t affect gold teeth.
steps.content: Know whitening agents won’t affect gold teeth. If you are interested in using tooth whitening strips or toothpaste, be aware that it won’t affect gold teeth. The compounds in the whitening agent won’t change the color of the gold as it whitens your natural teeth. [3] X Research source Most whitening strips are made with hydrogen peroxide, and they work by removing the top salivary layer from your teeth. The hydrogen peroxide then lifts the stain away, and the salivary layer is replenished over the next few days. [4] X Expert Source Alina Lane, DDS Board Certified Dentist Expert Interview. 21 April 2020.

steps.title: Schedule cleanings with your dentist.
steps.content: Schedule cleanings with your dentist. Gold teeth should be maintained just like regular teeth or other crowns and fillings. This means you should continue scheduling regular oral checkups with your dentist. During an oral checkup, your dentist will clean your teeth, including your gold tooth or crown. They will also look for any problems, like gingivitis or periodontal disease.

steps.title: Clean a removable tooth with cleaner.
steps.content: Clean a removable tooth with cleaner. If you have a removable gold tooth, you should clean it daily. You should do this with a non-abrasive cleaner. After cleaning it, you should rinse the tooth with warm water and pat dry. [5] X Research source Talk to your dentist about the proper cleaner. You can buy cleansers specifically designed for cleaning gold teeth online.

steps.title: Use a cloth to polish your tooth.
steps.content: Use a cloth to polish your tooth. After you have cleaned your tooth, make sure you pat it dry. Then, use a soft cloth to polish your tooth before placing it back in your mouth. This helps the tooth retain its shine and luster. Try a soft cotton microfiber cloth.

steps.title: Quit smoking.
steps.content: Quit smoking. If you have gold teeth, you should quit smoking . Smoking will tarnish your gold tooth and cause it to lose its shine. [6] X Research source If you don’t want to quit smoking, then you should choose a higher-quality gold for your tooth. For example, you should choose 18 or 24 karat gold if you want to continue smoking. It won’t tarnish as quickly as lower quality.

steps.title: Refrain from using gold jewelry cleaners.
steps.content: Refrain from using gold jewelry cleaners. Though you may think that cleaning your solid gold or gold-plated teeth with jewelry cleaner is a good idea, it is not. Jewelry cleaners are toxic when ingested. This means you should never clean your gold teeth with jewelry cleaners. [7] X Research source Additionally, you should never use gold polish on gold teeth.

steps.title: Clean your grill daily.
steps.content: Clean your grill daily. If you wear a removable grill, you should remove it each day to clean it. Brush the grill with toothpaste to clean it and remove any debris. Rinse it with warm water. Then, between uses, place the grill in antiseptic mouthwash to sanitize it. [8] X Research source Cleaning it each day removes bacteria that can accumulate in the grill, along with removing remnants of leftover food.

steps.title: Wash your grill with soap and water.
steps.content: Wash your grill with soap and water. Another way to clean your grill is to use mild dishwashing liquid. Remove your grill and soak it in a bowl of warm water mixed with dishwashing liquid. Let it soak for about an hour or two, and then let it air dry. You can also pat it dry.

steps.title: Limit how long you wear a grill.
steps.content: Limit how long you wear a grill. Grills are removable gold-plated covers you snap over your teeth. Make sure that you don’t wear your grill all the time. Food and bacteria can get trapped beneath the grill, and if you wear it for extended periods of time, it can lead to tooth and gum decay. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Remove your grill when eating.
steps.content: Remove your grill when eating. To keep your grill and teeth clean and healthy, remove your grill before eating. Eating while wearing a grill can cause food to get trapped beneath the grill, leading to the growth of bacteria and tooth decay. Food caught under the grill can also injure your sensitive gum tissue.
